column4: does anyone know why my screen resolution would, after a reboot (with no changes being made in the last few days), limit itself to only 640x480?
has this ever happened to anyone? You reboot and all of a sudden you're in 640x480 with no higher res?
did you try doing an apt-get dist-upgrade?
do you have dapper-updates in you apt repos?
some people were having problems with a recent xorg update in dapper.. but it was supposidly fixed
all you should have to do is sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
but if that did not work.. i'm not sure
did ifup eth0 work?
so trying "ping -c3 www.yahoo.com" gives you nothing?
are you using a dhcp router?
are you using wired or wireless/
you can try rebooting.. or setting it up so that it is not static IP.. but i doubt that will help
good
ok.. what is the video card?
I understand.. do you have proprietary drivers or xorg drivers?
gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf under Section "Device" it should say what driver you are using
ok.. you are using the vesa driver
that is more then likely your problem
somehow you have two devices in your Xorg.. you should only have one
the fglrx one
probably an update wrote to your xorg file
you shouldn't have to reboot.. just do "ctrl+alt+backspace" to restart the xserver
